intro: Meconopsis rudis, commonly known as the Welsh poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Wales and western England. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are palmately lobed and hairy. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Meconopsis rudis is a valuable addition to alpine gardens and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
